result.execSummary:
The defendant Floyd S Delaney-Bolden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Huber/work release notification

Case called at a10:03 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Floyd S Delaney-Bolden in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments by Counsel; Statements by Sabrina Bolden & Latrina Delaney; Statements by Mr. Delaney-Bolden

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--To serve 5 months & 15 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment, family care & treatment, to commence 6/19/15 at 7:00 pm 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process.
--To undergo any assessment, treatment, therapy or counseling as per Agent
--Pursue and obtain GED or HSED or educational equivalent
--Not commit any traffic violations
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

6 month driver license suspension
115 days credit given for time already served
Court presents basis and grants expungement under 973.015, upon successful completion of probation
Sentence may transfer to Milwaukee County as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Recess: 10:45 pm
Sentencing hearing on April 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Criminal Case Settlement
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 2:23 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Floyd S Delaney-Bolden in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that they will be requesting later sentencing date
ADA Beck informs the Court that the State will request the Court revoke bond following entry of plea

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1
ADA Beck withdraws request to revoke bond
Court reminds Mr. Delaney-Bolden that his bond continues pending sentencing
Recess: 2:34 pm

NEXT: Schedule Sentencing Hearing 4/9/15 at 9:30 am - Send notices
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

case called at 9:19am. [MK]
Defendant Floyd S Delaney-Bolden in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa requests the scheduling of another status conference in a few weeks; he believes that the Defense will be prepared to finalize that case at that time.  
The Court refers the case to Branch III for scheduling. 
The Court hears arguments on the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond from a Cash Bond to a Signature Bond. 
The Court grants the Motion and amends the bond so that it is a $10,000 with the special conditions:
--must provide a valid residential and mailing address 
--not to operate a motor vehicle
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin

recess 9:28am. 

NEXT:  case referred to Branch III for scheduling, possibly for a Status Conference (likely Plea/Sentencing) in Branch III in early January

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 2:17pm. 
Defendant Floyd S Delaney-Bolden appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J. De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Both parties acknowledge receipt of the criminal responsibility report; the examiner found that a NGI plea is not appropriate in this case.  
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the Defense is withdrawing the NGI plea and proceeding on the "Not Guilty" pleas only.  In response to the Court's inquiry, Mr. Delaney-Bolden indicates that he is in agreement with withdrawing the NGI plea. 
recess 2:22pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/15/14 at 3:40pm  (2) schedule Status Conference during the week of October 20th

case called at 9:17am.
Defendant Floyd S Delaney-Bolden in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J. De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Delaney-Bolden waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "Not Guilty" and "Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect" entered
The Court orders Dr. James Freiburger to conduct a criminal responsibility examination; his report is to be filed by 9/19/14. 
recess 9:20am.

NEXT:  schedule Status Conference during week of Sept. 29th, or if not possible, then during the week of October 6th

Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 2:14 pm
Defendant Floyd S Delaney-Bolden in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB listed on the criminal complaint is correct.
Defendant provides updated address to the Court.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1 & #2.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Public Service Flint requests the Court amend a scribbiners error on page 2 to correct Dousman Rd to Delafield Rd. 
No objection from Attorney Svehlek.
Court amends the complaint by it's own hand.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Not to operate a motor vehicle 

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit. (requested by the Defense)

Recess: 2:27 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 8/18/14 at 9:00 am
